content:
Yes, there are several hidden gems in Bhubaneswar that are not as popular but are definitely worth visiting. Here are some of them:

1. Ansupa Lake: It is a serene freshwater lake located about 40 km away from Bhubaneswar. It is a perfect spot for a picnic or a lazy afternoon. 2. Kedar Gauri Temple: It is a lesser-known temple located in Old Town, Bhubaneswar. The temple is dedicated to Lord Shiva and his consort Goddess Gauri. 3. Pathani Samanta Planetarium: It is a popular attraction among locals but is relatively unknown to tourists. It offers a unique experience of the night sky and the mysteries of the universe through various shows and programs. 4. Nandankanan Zoological Park: Located on the outskirts of the city, this zoo is home to a range of animals including white tiger, lion, leopard, and many more. It also features a botanical garden and a lake. 5. Deras Dam: Situated around 22 km from Bhubaneswar, Deras Dam is a preferred spot for those who love to spend time in nature. It is surrounded by hills and forests, offering a scenic view. These are just a few of the hidden gems in Bhubaneswar. Explore the city and you may discover many more!
